com.jobboard.tracker.controllers

Class JobApplicationController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jobboard.tracker.controllers.JobApplicationController

  • @RestController
public class JobApplicationController
extends Object
    The class exposes all the APIs towards the user interface to add/update/delete/get job application by user. It also exposes a GET API to get the statistics of applications made by the user.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JobApplicationController() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity addNewJobApplication(@NotBlank JobApplication jobApplication, String userId, String univId)
      POST API: /application exposed towards the User Interface.
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity fetchJobApplications(@Min(value=1L) long startId, @Max(value=2000L) long numberOfRecords, String userId, String univId)
      The GET API: /application exposed towards the user interface to fetch all the job applications added to the system by the user.
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity fetchMetaData(String userId, String univId)
      The GET API: /application/data exposed towards the user interface and allows the UI to fetch statistics of the applications made by the user.
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity removeJobApplication(long id)
      The DELETE API: /application/{id} exposed towards the user interface to allow user delete a job application that was added already
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity updateJobApplication(@NotBlank JobApplication jobApplication, @NotBlank long applicationId, String userId, String univId)
      The PUT API: /application/{applicationId} exposed towards the user interface to allow user to update job application already added.

    • Method Detail

      • addNewJobApplication

        @PostMapping(value="/application")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity addNewJobApplication(@Validated @NotNull @NotBlank @RequestBody
                                                                                                        @NotBlank JobApplication jobApplication,
                                                                                                        @RequestHeader(value="x-uid") @Validated @NotNull
                                                                                                        String userId,
                                                                                                        @RequestHeader(value="x-univ-id") @Validated @NotNull
                                                                                                        String univId)
        POST API: /application exposed towards the User Interface. The API allows user to add a new job application
        Parameters:
        jobApplication - The JobApplication object containing all the details of the new application user wants to add
        userId - The unique id assigned to user by the authenticator and is sent in request header
        univId - The unique id assigned to University by the authenticator and is sent in request header.
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity object with response body and appropriate HTTP status code.

      • updateJobApplication

        @PutMapping(value="/application/{applicationId}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity updateJobApplication(@Validated @NotNull @NotBlank @RequestBody
                                                                                                                       @NotBlank JobApplication jobApplication,
                                                                                                                       @PathVariable @Validated @NotBlank @NotNull
                                                                                                                       @NotBlank long applicationId,
                                                                                                                       @RequestHeader(value="x-uid") @Validated @NotNull
                                                                                                                       String userId,
                                                                                                                       @RequestHeader(value="x-univ-id") @Validated @NotNull
                                                                                                                       String univId)
        The PUT API: /application/{applicationId} exposed towards the user interface to allow user to update job application already added.
        Parameters:
        jobApplication - The JobApplication object containing all updated details of the new application user wants to add
        applicationId - The unique ID of the job application sent to User interface while adding the new job application
        userId - The unique id assigned to user by the authenticator and is sent in request header
        univId - The unique id assigned to University by the authenticator and is sent in request header.
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity object with response body and appropriate HTTP status code.

      • removeJobApplication

        @DeleteMapping(value="/application/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity removeJobApplication(@PathVariable
                                                                                                               long id)
        The DELETE API: /application/{id} exposed towards the user interface to allow user delete a job application that was added already
        Parameters:
        id - The unique ID assigned to the job application while adding it.
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity with 201 HTTP status code if success, a 404 status code if id not found, 500 status code otherwise.

      • fetchJobApplications

        @GetMapping(value="/application")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity fetchJobApplications(@RequestParam @Min(value=1L)
                                                                                                       @Min(value=1L) long startId,
                                                                                                       @RequestParam @Max(value=2000L)
                                                                                                       @Max(value=2000L) long numberOfRecords,
                                                                                                       @RequestHeader(value="x-uid") @Validated @NotNull
                                                                                                       String userId,
                                                                                                       @RequestHeader(value="x-univ-id") @Validated @NotNull
                                                                                                       String univId)
        The GET API: /application exposed towards the user interface to fetch all the job applications added to the system by the user. The API support pagination enabling the user interface fetch records in pages (i.e. few records at a time).
        Parameters:
        startId - The unique Id of the job applications starting from which the job applications should be returned
        numberOfRecords - The maximum number of job applications to be returned.
        userId - The unique id assigned to user by the authenticator and is sent in request header
        univId - The unique id assigned to University by the authenticator and is sent in request header.
        Returns:
        Returns a maximum of {numberOfRecords} job applications beginning from the startId.

      • fetchMetaData

        @GetMapping(value="/application/data")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity fetchMetaData(@RequestHeader(value="x-uid") @Validated @NotNull
                                                                                                     String userId,
                                                                                                     @RequestHeader(value="x-univ-id") @Validated @NotNull
                                                                                                     String univId)
        The GET API: /application/data exposed towards the user interface and allows the UI to fetch statistics of the applications made by the user.
        Parameters:
        userId - The unique id assigned to user by the authenticator and is sent in request header
        univId - The unique id assigned to University by the authenticator and is sent in request header.
        Returns:
        Returns the meta data of the job applications made by the user.
